title: April 2021 security update bricked my Pixel 5 phone
content:
My Pixel 5 is completely unusable after installing the most recent security update, won't turn on at all. 

Yesterday (April 14, 2021) I got the notification about the security update. My phone was 100% charged, under a year old, purchased directly from the Google Store in November 2020, had no physical damage of any kind, running on Android 11, and was working fine.

As soon as I installed the security update, it completely bricked my phone. Briefly showed the wrong screen lock (Pattern instead of PIN) for a minute, then got permanently stuck in FastBoot mode and showed red "error!" text next to "Device-State" field with error reason "Failed to load/verify boot images." 

I tried using the volume and power buttons to try to get into Recovery mode but it kept returning to red FastBoot mode. I tried everything that Google Support recommended over chat and nothing worked, so now I have to get a replacement phone.

Has this happened to anyone else recently? I see that this has happened to other people with past Security Updates over the years immediately breaking some Pixel 2, 4, etc phones, so I thought there would be a solution for this by now? Thanks!
